page.title: 19LANDSCAPE - Brocton Caves.
page.content: Brocton caves were used as a house until February,1945. The house had two rooms.They were the living room and the bedroom.There were more rooms but they were made from sandstone.These rooms were the pantry,smallbedroom and kitchen.The cooking was done on a small black range.The cottage was called Rock Cottage. It had mains water but no gas or electricity. This meant an oil lamp was used for lighting.The last occcupant of the cottage was Miss.Mary Evans. She was born there and lived there until she was eighty.She did the garden all herself.It was one acre and it had fruit,flowers and vegtables.She took these to the market to sell.The toilet was at the bottom of the garden because there was no modern toilets in the house. Told by Mrs.Pugh to Alice Wright (11)
